title: What yoga does to your body and brain - Krishna Sudhir

title: Can steroids save your life? - Anees Bahji

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of the hypothalamus in the body's stress response?

options.label: B
options.text: To send a signal to the pituitary gland

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between naturally occurring and synthetic steroids?

options.label: A
options.text: Naturally occurring steroids are more effective

options.label: C
options.text: Synthetic steroids have the same molecular structure as naturally occurring steroids

options.label: D
options.text: Synthetic steroids have a different molecular structure than naturally occurring steroids

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of cortisol in the body's stress response?

options.label: A
options.text: To increase digestion and glucose production

options.label: B
options.text: To decrease functions not immediately related to survival

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of cortisol on the immune system in the short term?

options.label: C
options.text: To have no effect on inflammation

options.label: D
options.text: To suppress the immune system's ability to produce inflammation

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary use of corticosteroids in medicine?

options.label: B
options.text: To treat allergic reactions and inflammation

multiple-choice.question: What is the difference between intravenous or oral corticosteroids and inhalers or creams?

options.label: A
options.text: Intravenous or oral corticosteroids are more expensive

options.label: B
options.text: Inhalers or creams are more effective

options.label: C
options.text: Intravenous or oral corticosteroids impact the whole body, while inhalers or creams only impact the affected organ

options.label: D
options.text: Inhalers or creams are used to treat chronic autoimmune conditions

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of long-term exposure to corticosteroids?

options.label: A
options.text: To increase the immune system's ability to regenerate bone marrow and lymph nodes

options.label: B
options.text: To decrease the immune system's ability to regenerate bone marrow and lymph nodes

options.label: C
options.text: To have no effect on the immune system

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of the pituitary gland in the body's stress response?

options.label: B
options.text: To send a signal to the adrenal glands

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of cortisol on the immune system in the long term?

options.label: C
options.text: To have no effect on inflammation

options.label: D
options.text: To suppress the immune system's ability to produce inflammation

options.label: A
options.text: The steroids used to build muscle are more effective

options.label: B
options.text: The steroids used to build muscle have a different molecular structure than the steroids used in medicine

options.label: C
options.text: The steroids used to build muscle are less expensive

options.label: D
options.text: The steroids used to build muscle have the same molecular structure as the steroids used in medicine

options.label: C
options.text: Lying is a natural human behavior.

options.label: D
options.text: Lying is always easy to spot.

options.text: An honest person is more likely to deny the accusation, while a deceptive person is more likely to accept it.

options.label: B
options.text: An honest person is more likely to be cooperative and enthusiastic, while a deceptive person is more likely to be withdrawn and defensive.

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Liars tend to avoid eye contact.

options.label: D
options.text: Liars tend to touch their face more often.

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: B

options.text: They both start from seeds and eggs, but the plant grows into an adult plant and the butterfly becomes a bird.

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: They both start from seeds and eggs, but the plant grows into a seedling and the frog becomes a young frog.

options.label: B
options.text: They both undergo metamorphosis, but the plant remains the same form and the frog changes into a completely different form.

options.label: C
options.text: They both start from seeds and eggs, but the plant grows into an adult plant and the frog becomes a bird.

options.label: D
options.text: They both undergo metamorphosis, but the plant remains the same form and the frog becomes a completely different form.

title: Home sweet habitat: Crash Course Kids

multiple-choice.question: What is a habitat?

options.label: C
options.text: Food, shelter, and a place to play

options.text: A system that includes only animals in a habitat

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: C
options.text: Because it has the right body adaptations to survive in the desert

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: Why should you wear sunscreen?

options.text: To protect their skin from the sun's harmful rays.

options.label: A
